goal: Let players injure and kill wildlife via body-part damage, spawn species-specific corpses, and butcher them into meat, hide, and fat using axes/knives.
decisions: On vital-part death, remove the living wildlife entity and place a corpse object at its position, carrying species identity and a simple freshness/rot timer.
Define per-species yield tables for meat, hide, and fat and keep the first implementation conservative so early kills give modest but meaningful resources.
Implement butchering as a use pattern (use knife/axe on corpse) that consumes the corpse, grants items, and awards appropriate survival/tailoring skill XP.
plan: Add a corpse object type with metadata for species and freshness, and update wildlife death handling to spawn corpses when body-part rules say an animal dies.
Create items for raw_meat variants, raw_hide, and animal_fat, and integrate their weights/descriptions into the existing item registry.
Implement butchering interactions for axes/knives on corpses, consuming the corpse and yielding species-based resources while updating skills and messages.
Hook raw meat into the existing cooking flow so players can grill fresh meat over the cabin fire.
notes: Keep gore-level text mild and reflective to stay aligned with the healing/nature tone even when butchering.
Future work can extend corpses with more detailed rot stages and scavenger wildlife behavior.
